tasks.task: Pruning fruit trees in winter for homesteading purposes.
subtasks: Trimming branches with sharp crotch angles (near 90 degrees).
Removing crisscrossing branches and touching limbs.
Cutting back diseased or broken branches.
Using pruning tools like saws and clippers to make precise cuts.
Cleaning pruners with rubbing alcohol between trees to prevent disease spread.
Considering overall tree structure and shaping for better sunlight penetration and fruit accessibility.
Inspecting trees for deer and animal damage.
Removing leftover branches and debris from previous years.
Checking for potential pest threats (e.g., coyotes) and taking preventive measures.
Ensuring tools are sharp and in good condition (e.g., pruning saws, clippers).
Staying aware of surroundings (e.g., checking for potential threats like coyotes).
Wearing appropriate clothing and gear (e.g., protective equipment for handling tools, dealing with wildlife).
